channel.title: CVE Feed for Really Simple Plugins -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Really Simple Plugins -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-5761|2024-08-02T08:07:32.680Z -- really%20simple%20plugins -- burst%20statistics%20pro
item.description: The Burst Statistics â€“ Privacy-Friendly Analytics for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the 'url' parameter in versions 1.4.0 to 1.4.6.1 (free) and versions 1.4.0 to 1.5.0 (pro) due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.

item.title: CVE-2024-31229|2024-06-04T17:37:20.022Z -- really%20simple%20plugins -- really%20simple%20ssl
item.description: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Really Simple Plugins Really Simple SSL.This issue affects Really Simple SSL: from n/a through 7.2.3.
